projects.category: Application for electronic artists to create and organize their performance setups
projects.title: BleepBloop
projects.description: Managed app state with Context API to reduce the need for prop-drilling. Implemented Active Storage with AWS S3 to store user avatars. Authenticated users at login and assured user password security by hashing them with bcrypt. Styled dropdown menu with Material UI and remaining front-end with Bootstrap to maintain sylistic consistency.

projects.category: application for runners in NYC to upload routes and write reviews on them to share with each other
projects.title: Big Apple Runners
projects.description: Engineered user interface with Javascript & React and styled with Bootstrap and Styled Components. Implemented Rails Serializer to allow for all data to be fetched through a singular route. Modeled database schema and RESTful API routes with Active Record for more streamlined database interaction. Utilized localstorage to store encrypted user information.

projects.category: Job board application for quick gigs for creatives
projects.title: Quicky
projects.description: Used Ruby with a Sinatra API on the backend to store both seeded and new user entered data.  Utilized byebug gem to aid in debugging throughout development process. Designed a filter feature to allow users to sort through listings by job type. Used OO design patterns by creating separate classes per model and used instance or class methods as necessary. Developed application with full CRUD capability on the listing model.
